Reviews.Title: “One Night Layover in MAD”
Reviews.Author: GATraveller
Reviews.Content: Business traveler stayed one night at the High Tech Madrid Aeropuerto for a layover between Lisbon and Atlanta. Overall, this is a good hotel. I noticed some other comments on TripAdvisor about the slow response times of the airport shuttle bus. I found out first-hand this is due to all the various airport terminal stops along the way. However, my return ride to the airport the next morning on the shuttle was less than 10 minutes from the hotel to T1. Tip: Be sure to sign-up for the time slot you need a shuttle ride. It probably seats 10-12 people, so you will want to eliminate the risk of missing a free-ride to the airport. Check-in / Check-out took less than 10 minutes. English-speaking staff were very hospitable and helpful. The room was large, compared to other hotels I've stayed in Europe. Queen bed (room 317) was comfortable. Took a visit to the check-in desk for instructions on how to operate the air-conditioning system, but once I got it turned on, it cooled the room within 10 minutes and stayed comfortable all night. Due to the late hour of my arrival at the hotel, I did not have a chance to explore the neighborhood to see if there were any good restaurants nearby; opted instead for a room-service meal which arrived in less than 15 minutes of ordering (at ~9pm). I think that's the fastest room service I've ever received! Bathroom is rather spacious, which makes me question why the hotel designer opted for such small, pre-fabricated shower stalls with no tub. This is the only flaw I see with this hotel. While it is easy to shower in the stall, it is near impossible to dry yourself off without banging your elbows into the shower doors. Exit the shower you must, in order to dry yourself. Free morning breakfast was very good; several choices. Since I opted for the 7:20am shuttle to the airport, I was the first person to arrive at the restaurant for breakfast (which opens at 7am). If I'm ever back in Madrid for a one-night layover, I would definitely consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and cheap but that is it...”
Reviews.Author: Logitrav
Reviews.Content: Convenient to airport... Efficient check in. It was cheaper for a room on bookings.com than on their own website, oddly. The wifi is poor enough... It is difficult to get on line and in ny case slow. The air con is only minimal. Breakfast average. Bus service to airport good.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but Good Location for Airport”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location near Barajas airport. Free shuttle bus. Swimming pool. Cons: The swimming pool is not open all day. The sun loungers are horrendously shaped and not at all comfortable. There are no towel facilities for the pool. The cafeteria inside and by the pool were rarely staffed and we found it very difficult to even get a cup of coffee let alone, a a cold drink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: NatAtl
Reviews.Content: Good value. We stayed for 2 days and were very satisfied. Very nice staff. Not too much in the area but Metro is close and about 25 minutes to most of the main sites. Our room was nice enough and clean for our party of four. The bathroom was clean as well, but in need of some repair. Whoever decided wood laminate in the bathroom was a good idea needs another job though. Nice that they had a laptop in the room and internet is free. Pool is small but nice. I would recommend but I think it is more like a 3 star hotel than a four.

Reviews.Title: “lacks a bit high-tech, great deal”
Reviews.Author: tgendorf
Reviews.Content: I was staying with family in this hotel, before catching an early plane from madrid airport. We were 3 and booked a family room, to find that is was a descent sized standard room with a king bed and 2 hostel-style bunk beds. Still that was no big deal, although I was expecting something a little bigger. The bathroom was big and had a massage shower. There is a dated laptop available in the room. We just used our WiFi, which was not very fast but sufficient. The hotel is in a quiet residential area and the free airport shuttle takes about 10 min to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic layover stay”
Reviews.Author: Joshk89
Reviews.Content: I was in madrid 1night en route to bilbao and choose to stay near the airport because of my flight the next day. I had arrived in from a very long flight from australia at around 6am and had requested an early check in. Upon arrival i was greeted by the friendly front desk staff whom spoke great english and was very helpful and there was a room ready for me. The room was fantastic had everything u wanted and was spacious. Beds were firm which was fantastic as i hate soft beds. The wifi and computer in the room were a big help for anything u needed to know. It was only a short walk the the metro and only around a 20min ride to the center or madrid. I would reccomend even staying here for a longer period and commuteing to sight see everyday as it was so easy an inexpensive. I work in a hotel myself and have seen alot of reviews saying that the food is expensive - first of all its a hotel food on site isnt going to be cheap i thought the prices were quite reasonable though i sort out something from the surroundings and ended up finding a pizza place a short distance behind the hotel and it was delicous and inexpensive. So overall would decinately stay again :).

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay the night before your flight”
Reviews.Author: SandraD7
Reviews.Content: Like the other high tech hotel we visited, this hotel had the laptop computer in our room and the HDTV--the two necessities of life these days. Comfortable beds, pretty bathroom, breakfast buffet, and a free shuttle to airport. Be sure to have the address and telephone number of airport hotels, because taxi drivers don't always know how to find these smaller hotels near airports, we've found.

Reviews.Title: “Hi-Tech Hotel near Madrid Airport”
Reviews.Author: Joyfulbarb
Reviews.Content: Overall, this wsa a good place to stay. They offered a breakfast with wide variety from continental, fresh fruit to scrambled eggs for Western travelers. The room seemed slightly small for three people, but it was clean. They provide a free shuttle to the airport, ten min top, which was very handy, especially with Madrid traffic. It was somewhat difficult to find even using a GPS because for some reason the address couldn't be entered into the GPS at first. We did suggest that they improve their directions, which were given on the website, but still made it difficult to find. I would still recommend this hotel for its closeness to the airport plus they accept dogs! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Brian O
Reviews.Content: Teroom was perfect, very clean, very confortable, internet was a little slow, but i can use the pc of the room. Personal was very friendly and honest, price perfect in evry sense. The price of dinner was high but the foo perfect. The shower with hidtomassage disnt work, but at the end, evrything was good

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and Rallye helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kazekuma
Reviews.Content: My Family and I checked in to this hotel since we had to stay overnight because our connection flight was canceled. I called the hotel and they picked us up very fast even though it was nearly midnight. All staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean. Of course the surrounding neighborhood might not be so nice but who expects such a thing from an airport hotel. In case I want to do sightseeing in Madrid I naturally opt for a hotel in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Stranger than strange”
Reviews.Author: Sybelle49
Reviews.Content: This is one of the strangest hotels I've ever been to. The washroom door doesn't really have any privacy because although it is mostly frosted, there is one square cut out in the middle so you can see through it. Then there's the complications with the shower. Maybe I'm just new to multi-showerhead stand up showers, but it took way too long to figure out how to turn it on. We called the staff to help us and even they struggled. In the end, we only picked this hotel because it was close to the airport. However, the staff were great, the room was nice, and the facilities were interesting to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “good food and trendy comfort raise the bar for airport stops”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: Handy for the airport, stylish and comfortable with excellent dining in-house and a variety of options nearby, including Metro to City Centre. Perfect for a late arrival and/or early departure without compromising.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for a night stop”
Reviews.Author: richeyint
Reviews.Content: I thought that by beeing at the airport the hotel would be very close. They have a shuttle until 11.45pm but as arrived at around mid night I had to take a taxi that cost me 26€ which is almost the same as a taxi to the center... As it was on a friday night, I'd rather had gone to the city instead if I knew a taxi would be so expensive... The room was warm and comfortable but I could hear some noise from the next room. Breakfast is just OK Internet is a plus. I had my Ipad but used the PC in the room which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: Ana Mette B
Reviews.Content: Nice place, close to the airport, free WiFi, rooms OK. A bit of problems checking in, because we have ordered smoking room, the ionly vacant smoking room was a single room. So we had to change room, and smo...!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping on the airport floor would have been better!”
Reviews.Author: clubsail
Reviews.Content: The hotel was shabby, dirty with uncaring staff. They advertised a 4* hotel with room service - nothing available! Breakfast was not worth eating, but not the worst feature of the hotel! The floor in the room was loose, and had not been cleaned for a long time. The shower was broken, and worst of all was the springs showing through the mattress. All in all the worst hotel I have EVER stayed in, and not worth even 1 *!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jandelle
Reviews.Content: It’s a tricky proposition setting up a chain of hotels on the promise of “High Tech” when the pace of technological innovation far outstrips that of hotel refurbishment. So if you came here for the latest in technology you might be disappointed. Our room was equipped with a Dell laptop which seemed to have a broken catch and we could not open. The all-body power shower was only functioning in simple shower mode. But if you just came here for a hotel then you’d be happy to find an Ethernet cable to jack into your laptop, a comfortable and smart room and bathroom and free wifi. The location is great for Madrid airport. You could probably walk it though I really would not recommend it – as with so many airports the surrounding roads are not intended for pedestrians. In a vehicle it’s about five minutes. We had pre-arranged a third party pickup at the airport which went smoothly, only to find that the hotel had a free shuttle service. The helpful receptionist cancelled our car for the next day so that was 22 Euros saved. We had a good meal in the restaurant with helpful staff. The “secret recipe” Iberian pork was excellent (very tender slices of high quality pork with a BBQ style sauce) and the calamari very tender. The macchiato was a disaster – about 50% milk and it tasted homogenised at that; but the Riioja at 12 Euros was very decent. Breakfast is the usual buffet affair with decent bacon, tasteless scrambled egg, tortilla, beans, pastries, juices etc. The bean machine coffee was fine. There are about 80 rooms. The beds were comfortable and we had a quiet night in a room at the back. The hotel is in a residential area and not on yet fairly close to the main airport road so I think there will always be a background hum of traffic, but it’s reasonably quiet. Sound insulation between the rooms is average. The room and bathroom were decently sized, smartly furnished and very clean. We booked our shuttle to the airport for 09:20 (they go about every 40 minutes in the morning). It was a little late, but the minibus was smart and comfortable and the driver friendly and courteous. Our all up cost for the night, for two, with a two course dinner with wine, room, breakfast and shuttle was EU160 which I thought good value. You could get to central Madrid from this hotel without too much hassle, but I would not choose it as a base with that as the main purpose. However as an overnight stop when passing through the airport it makes an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “at best just adequate”
Reviews.Author: paul026
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely nothing that would inspire you to ever want to return here.The lobby is awful. It has a run down cheap feel and look. Although I slept ok the bed is not comfortable.Pillows dreadful. The main selling point of the property is its high tech feature with room laptops and proximity to the airport. The internet feature is a little on the slow side. The area is featureless, but it is an airport hotel. The whole place lacks imagination and ambiance.The food is expensive, very expensive and very poor considering the price, but there again I had little choice. Also the restauarnt did not open until 8.30pm which, considering that people may have a very early start in the morning is a bit on the late side. This is the second hotel in Madrid I have stayed at in 2 month's that you have to go down on hands and knee's to negotiate a room safe(at the bottom of a wardrobe) which believe me is an ordeal for people in and approaching senior years, I would imagine 60+ would form a large part of the hotels customers. Management should recify this it is just not acceptable. I will be spending 2 nights in Madrid on my return home. It most certainly will not be at this hotel. It does absolutely nothing even at the most basic level to encourage even a thought of another shot so to speak. It is neither a good advertisement for some of the other HT hotels in the Madrid area. Yes it was adequate but next time it will be another choice

Reviews.Title: “4star my @&%”
Reviews.Author: xolidot
Reviews.Content: where do i start ?! hotel is very run down, in an equally uninspiring location - proximity to the airport yes but not that much but to their credit there is a free shuttle, however erratic. <please do not belive the pictures on their site, you would think it a proper, comfortable four star, nothing could be further from the truth, it is a 2star hotel with some amenities that should make it a 4 star but dont quite pull it off, in short. The service OMG from having to lug your luggage to your room, to having to fetch your own glasses or whatever you need you from the ground floor, The bunkbeds - not really safe. The place is a dump. It is trully depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean airport accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Pilot-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several of the airport hotels at Madrid it simply comes down to a matter of how long you need to stay here. Would not recommend for stays longer than one night. We reserved a double room online, two weeks before arriving. On arrival at Madrid airport we were told we would have to wait 40 minutes for the free transportation. We walked. First impressions were good, efficient check in and comfortable bar and lobby. However, our room allocated was a twin-bedded room and when we returned to reception to ask for the room we had booked, we were told there were none left. Why sell rooms that you do not have? That said, the room itself was very clean and well presented with a good sized, modern and immaculately clean bathroom. The room had a flat screen Freeview TV and a laptop offering free internet access. This was a nice gesture, but for a 'High Tech' hotel, the laptop worked at a snails pace on a completely outdated operating system. Top tip - take a laptop or iPad and use the much faster free WiFi (another nice touch). The beds however left a lot to be desired, I have never spent a night in a bed as hard and uncomfortable as this in my life. For a quick airport stopover, this hotel is perfect. The return transfer was efficient and on time. Personally as I did not get one decent nights sleep over a 3 night stay due to how uncomfortable the beds were, I shall not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of issues”
Reviews.Author: tripguru u
Reviews.Content: We were only planning to stay over 1 night in Madrid to catch a flight and thought the hotel was a good deal. We booked the room through their website and it still took over 5 minutes to get checked in just to come back to reception because the key didnt work. The walls are paper thin so we ended up listening to some family's children crying all night. We ordered 2 burgers through room service which came almost raw. For Euros 105 per night we expected at least a duvet cover instead you get a sheet and a scruffy blanket. Breakfast in the restaurant was mediocre and upon check out we were charged twice for breakfast, suggest you thoroughly review the bill. Definitely would not be on our list to stay there again when in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: terabeloe
Reviews.Content: We changed to this hotel after having a bad experience at another Madrid Hotel. This property offered Free Airport transportation, free breakfast and a laptop to use in your room! It was a short 10 minute walk to the Metro, which is very easy and safe to use! The hotel staff was very friendly and spoke English. The rooms very clean and had everything we needed for a short 2 night stay! Would stay here again if ever in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “noisy, room needs maintenance but nice staff”
Reviews.Author: fran07Belgium
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in a family room overnight due to a connecting flight. Rooms are not isolated so the slightest noise from near rooms is easily heard. The upper bunk bed made lots of noise whenever my son tried to change position during sleep. The room included breakfast buffet but eggs and omelettes had a funny taste and bacon was simply raw. No big choice of food. The swimming pool only opens at 13.00 hs which makes no sense when the temperature reaches the upper 30s C. We tried this hotel because all our usual choices were overbooked due to the Pope's presence in Madrid. Anyway the reception desk staff were nice and the transportation shuttle to the airport worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dodge4x4rules
Reviews.Content: Only 3 blocks (5-7 minutes walking) from the metro that let you get anywhere in Madrid! Since there is also a free shuttle from the airport, it is a very easy hotel to use when you don't know the town. You can fly in, call them for a pickup, then use the metro for the rest of your stay (at 9 euros for a 10 pass, the metro is a cheap and easy way to get around).

Reviews.Title: “Not near MAD airport”
Reviews.Author: Creeping_Death_LA
Reviews.Content: We were forced to spend one night due to a flight misconnect, the layover was way to short to continue to Melilla. I had planned this in advance and wanted a hotel near the airport. When I checked google maps it looked almost walking distance to the airport, NOT. The hotel is in a neighborhood with many apartments everywhere, there are other hotels nearby too. You have to call the hotel for their shuttle to pick you up unless by luck they are already at the airport for some other guests. Be patient. The check in was quick for us and the room was nice and clean. Its a good value for the price but don't stay more than one night here or you will regret it. The hotel is not convenient to get to the city center, this is just for a layover.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for weekend trip in sun!”
Reviews.Author: Leana789
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with group of friends for weekend in the sun and had very good time! Hotel has good sized rooms and was very clean. Staff were helpful but not the easiest as staff speak very little English and we didnt speak any Spanish. Hotel has bar but this closes early, around midnight. Does serve food but only in the afternoons. Rooms have mini bars, quite well stocked but as usual not the cheapest. Hotel boasts of high tech equipment and all rooms are fitted with laptops which was good for looking at local maps etc. There is great pool outside which is covered in winter but sunbeds are very limited. We were promised massage bath which didnt get and shower jets didnt work in massage shower but didnt actually need these things so no loss! Air con was a bit hit and miss though! Hotel in residential area so very few bars around but very close to metro which is about half hr into central of Madrid. All in all we wanted a clean, tidy, cheap hotel, easy into Madrid and easy for airport and this hotel ticks all of those boxes. Its not the place for a weeks holiday or for families but if you are group of friends wanting a weekend away its great!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Airport Shuttle Service!”
Reviews.Author: KPDenver
Reviews.Content: We were told the airport shuttle ran every 20 mins...not true. After waiting 30 minutes we called the hotel. They said it is a requirement to call the hotel for pickup (very difficult when you don't have a local telephone). None of the other airport hotels seemed to require this and we certainly were not advised of this in advance. Even after calling, we waited an additional 35 minutes which is outrageous since the hotel is 2 miles away. The front desk was very unhelpful about our situation. In the mornings, the hotel has a limited schedule, running about every 40 minutes which is quite inconvenient. Aside from the transportation, the hotel is clean and cheap and ok for a quick stay.

Reviews.Title: “Technology surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lallonzo
Reviews.Content: We had planned a stopover in Madrid airport, but now we have seen the cost price of this hotel. As soon as we arrived we were impressed by the style piacevolmenti technology and furniture. The room was very spacious, comfortable beds, television and a laptop with free internet. The bathroom was fantastic, what a great room with a wonderful shower. Breakfast costs so much, do not do it for the rest, position aside (but very close to the subway), a hotel that deserves!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've stayed last 6 months”
Reviews.Author: jepper222
Reviews.Content: When arriving i was told the pool was closed during winter. On the site there is information that it is open all year long. The rooms are very noisy and so is the cleaningcrew, starting earlyin the morning. Don't go to dine in the restaurant!!! Ist low quality and expensive. I.e. the desert "fruit of the seison" was one peeled and sliced sour orange......which costs 6 euro's. Bar and restaurant personell is nice and polite though.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: kft777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a hotel for a one night stay because air connections didn't line up (e.g. our flight from North Africa got in after the usual time for flights to the US). So we read several reviews and chose this one because it was a reasonable price, close to the airport and had a complementary shuttle. Getting to the hotel was very easy. We followed the signs in the airport to the 'hotel shuttles' where there was a list of hotels with shuttles and their telephone numbers prominently displayed on a large column at the bus shuttle location. Another traveler had arrived just before us who was going to the same hotel and had already called (although there is a regular service). Otherwise we would have called using our prepaid cellphone with a sim card that works in 140 countries (and it does, for about 60 cents a minute). As other reviewers have said in more detail, the room was a decent size, very clean, had lots of high tech advantages (including electrical sockets that were actually near the desk and not loaded up with other appliances). Interesting shower although I never did figure out how to work the extra nozzles. The front desk cheerfully gave me three different free passwords and codes so we could log in with my husband's computer, my computer and my US cellphone which picks up wireless. I used the GPS on the phone to find out what was in the immediate area. The hotel is in a very nice residential neighborhood with lots of trees. It was a short and very pleasant walk to the metro to go into central Madrid. The Metro can easily get you to any site that you would want to see. We took a ride into Central Madrid (1 euro each way), had a nice walk, ate some Tapas and got back to the hotel easily and quickly. There is also a taxi stand just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - rude deskstaff.”
Reviews.Author: variablespeed
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was close to the airport and had a shuttle. My husband was to return the rental car the evening of our arrival and was given directions to the airport by the hotel staff, at that time he informed them he would need the shuttle to pick him up. At the airport he was unable to find the phone number to contact the shuttle and ended up taking a taxi back to the hotel. When he mentioned this to the front staff, they rudely told him he should have gone to the hotel counter at the airport. No one had told him that when he left the hotel. That evening I told the desk staff we would need a ride to the airport the next morning. I was told there were predefined departure times and we should be in the lobby and ready to leave 15 minutes before our departure time, which we did. When the shuttle arrived for the next group of passengers we were informed we had not made a reservation. When I told the clerk I had spoken with the clerk the night before I was informed the reservations could not be made the night before but had to be made in the morning. I pointed out that the clerk had not given me that information and was told it didn't matter - those were the rules! At that point I lost my temper and asked for the manager. We did get a ride on a later shuttle but only because the shuttle driver was the only person who seemed to understand and care about the hotel's customers. We traveled throughout Spain for almost 3 weeks before this stay and NEVER were treated rudely. In fact the people we met were wonderful. Too bad people in this hotel - our last night - had to ruin the record! I only say I would recommend this hotel because of the location. But I personally would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very High Tech hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: WooHooTraveller
Reviews.Content: we stayed 1 night at this hotel and we though it was great! it is a very modern high tech hotel, new furniture, laptop with internet in every room which was very useful. Very nice shower with hydro massage and free transfer to and from the airport was very useful as well. Generally we enjoyed our stay but we did not like that the air conditioning was not working and we were told it would not be on until May even though it was a very warm night in April. We did not understand why the designers of the hotel made the door to the bathroom trasparent as we prefer a bit more privacy and we had to put a bedspread on the door to cover the "window". Also if you are not eating in the hotel it is quite difficult to find a good dinner somewhere around, we only found a few bars and nobody speaks english there! so the location is very good if you need to be close to the airport but not for holidays/eating out. Generally I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the High Tech Aeropuerto for helping a stranded traveller”
Reviews.Author: Crwydryn
Reviews.Content: I was one of the hundreds of thousands stranded by flight cancellations following the Icelandic volcano eruption in April 2010. Due to fly back to the UK from Madrid on the day it all started, I was initially re-booked onto a flight the next day, and chose the High-Tech Aeropuerto as a convenient overnight stopover that offered free internet access. In the end, I had to renew my room reservation for another four nights until I could finally get a train for my return journey. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and welcoming; charged me the same room rate throughout even though demand was pushing up local charges; and allowed me unlimited free printing of timetables, flight bookings etc. My room was a decent size, and clean, with a comfortable bed, good shower, plenty of power sockets and the aforementioned internet access - WiFi, or ethernet, with a laptop provided in the room. Its speed was adequate if not outstanding. The lighting was excellent compared to most hotel rooms. Mobile phone rection was very good. The decor was a little tired in places, but the only real downside of the room was the TV - only 6 channels, of which two were in German, one was EuroSport, one seemed tgo be mainly a shopping channel, and the others were respectively an arts and a "lifestyle" channel in Spanish - nothing in English or French and no major news or film channels in any language. I'm not normally a great TV watcher, but under the circumstances more choice would have been a plus. The breakfast buffet was fine as far as I was concerned .- good choice of fruit, hot drinks and bakery products. I didn't eat an evening meal at the hotel as, like most of Spain, it wasn't very vegetarian-friendly. The nearest Metro station (1 Euro for the direct, reliable, frequent c 30 minute ride to the centre of town) is about 7 minutes' walk away; there is a small supermarket, a greengrocers', bakers', pharmacy and small cafes and bars slightly closer. As previously stated, though, ithe hotel is not in a major shopping or dining area. As a lone female traveller unexpectedly stranded I really needed somewhere safe and clean to stay, with good internet access, helpful staff and a rate that wasn't a rip-off. The High Tech Aeropuerto Madrid really met these needs, so a big thanks to all at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “way better than these other reviews imply”
Reviews.Author: rokitjogo
Reviews.Content: I don't know where a lot of these reviewers stayed, but I was thrilled with this hotel. For the same price as a private room in a hostel, we got a private bathroom with a killer massage shower. Everything was pristinely clean. We did not take advantage of the pool, although it looked fine to me. There is even a sauna! There is even a laptop computer in each room! and bike rental! The only drawback is that it is far from the sights at about a 30 minute commute, but it was perfect for our early morning flight with a 5 minute free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste ur euros”
Reviews.Author: yahnia
Reviews.Content: Weird smell in room off the scary neighborhood. No where to eat take lunch dinner breakfast. Restaurant is expensive. Very poor desk service. Dark dimly lit halls furnishings worn and dirty. Not for children. Glass doors on bathroom no privacy. The "high tech" shower did not work room wasn't clean the best thing was the shuttle. we were able to get to airport on time. If we hadn't arrived so late and had to leave out so early I'd stayed else where.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better options than this”
Reviews.Author: maranelloLondon
Reviews.Content: The name "High Tech" intruiged me and so I booked it for a one night stay. I was driving and that was the first nightmare. The hotel is hidden in the middle of a large sprawling housing estate on a one way street and is hard to locate even with satnav. I parked outside whilst I went to Reception to request access to the underground car park and was meet by a scruffy man who was the only person on duty. At this point I almost decided not to stay and I wish I had not but I was tired after a 400 mile drive. Lets cut to the chase.... here are my observations based on the fact it advertises itself as a 4 star hotel: 1. All fixtures and fittings are cheap and shoddy. As an example the bathroom floor was plastic strips of wood which were lifting due to water damage. 2. The internet connection, (free) is slow 3. Breakfast was potentially a health hazard, we ate early but the baked beans looked as if they were several days old and the boiled eggs were ice cold ie not recently cooked but probably yesterdays and kept in a fridge. The butter was warm. 4. The waitress was off handed with guests 5. No english speaking tv channels 6. The bathroom was not clean, wiping a finger over any surface showed dirt and dust 7. The worst complaint - I felt itchy in the morning and jumped right into the shower. When I examined my sheets they were covered in tiny black human hairs yet I am fair haired. This repulsed me, I wish I had checked prior to sleeping in the bed. I had, the previous week, stayed nearby at the amazing Axor Barajas hotel. What a difference and it was cheaper! The High Tech hotel is one to avoid like the plague, there are far better options in the area. Believe me, I am in the hotel trade and this place disgusted me.

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: ConchitaGris
Reviews.Content: What a bad place to stay. Thank God we only stayed here for one night before heading to the airport the next morning. It was convenient, that was it. It took about an hour for the hotel shuttle to pick us up, then we got to the hotel to a restaurant that offered very limited menu. Nothing else was around, so we ate what we could. The shower didn't work in our room and the beds were for kids. We had a bunk bed that was very hard. "high tech" it was not. Very slow internet in the rooms. The hotel front desk clerk was rude. There were no friendly staff at this hotel. Do not attempt to stay here even for a few hours to lay your head... not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent sized room but hard to find and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: stu20001
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room for one night after arriving in Madrid before continuing on to the coast. The good points: - The room itself was OK with a decent sized bed and bathroom with an excellent multijet shower. There are bunk beds for the kids (however see note below) - The breakfast buffet was good in the morning; - There is a laptop with free internet access in every room. The bad points: - A cot was provided for us as requested, however another family we were travelling with who had booked the same type of room were told there were no cots left as they only had 3 and they were all being used - pretty silly for a hotel with family rooms to have so few cots. - The top bunk had no safety rail so was unsuitable for smaller children. - The walls are *VERY* thin - you can hear every noise from the room next door. Bearing in mind that room in our case was another family room, that was a lot of noise. - Parking in the underground car park was an expensive extra at 15EUR for a night but one you have to take as parking in the road is very limited Worst point: - As many of teh reviews have already said, this hotel is ridiculously hard to find. On the map it's 5 minutes as the crow flies but it is buried in a maze of one way streets and motorway slip roads. We had satnav so just about found it but our friends who were relying on the directions from the hotel website got lost and took over an hour to get there as they drove around the one way system.

Reviews.Title: “Free In-room Internet access”
Reviews.Author: italyfan98
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Very conveniant for those with late or early flights. The in-room PCs and free internet is the stand out feature of this hotel. The rooms were very comfortable and large too. Very clean bathrooms. The restaurant does not offer much choice and is expensive. That is probably the only down side to this hotel. Staff were helpful in the main, and answered any questions i had. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the dirtiest rat hole i've seen in ages !”
Reviews.Author: DaSpy
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest hotel we have ever stayed in. There was a sewer, sweated smell in the whole hotel from the moment we entered it and it didn't change in the rooms. Took a taxi from Madrid Terminal 4 to the hotel which costed €21 EUR, which was more expensive than a ride into downtown Madrid. The access is made through a side road in between a downturned resitential area. There was a police car stationed at the entrance of the hotel which made us believe that we where entering an unsafe neighbourhood. Frontdesk immediately charged us for the room even before we had the chance to have a look at it. Once we hit the room we were shoked about what we had been charged 75€ for, considering that the 2 star Hotel Ibis is 100 times better than this rat hole.. All mirrors and glasses are totally dirty (see pictures), the shower temperature control is broken, the whole toilet has not been cleaned at all and there was black hairs all over the ground of the bathroom. The parquett floor had fissures and wasn't fixed on the ground which is even a saftey issue as specially older people can slip and fall on them. Everything in all i wouldn't return here even if i would get paid to. I had one of my worst sleeps ever and am totally disappointed. Also i cannot understand how the tourism office of Madrid can apply a four star rating to a hotel which fullfills not even the standard of a 2 star hotel and there should be made a sanitary inspection on the hygienical conditions of this rat hole.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest about amenities!”
Reviews.Author: sandy_flipflops
Reviews.Content: The worst part about this hotel was the amenities they claimed to have. We had 2 criteria: an indoor swimming pool and air conditioning. Their information claimed they have both. NOT. Their "indoor" heated swimming pool is neither indoors, nor heated. It is not even attached to the hotel. It is in the back yard on a cement slab, covered with an all glass UNHEATED glass-like enclosure. Somewhat like a greenhouse, but not heated. It was March, so evening tended to be cool. Having an unheated pool in an unheated enclosure was certainly not something that anyone could take advantage of in March. It probably isn't feasible in the summer either, as it also isn't air conditioned. That was the MAIN REASON we chose this hotel! Second, their "air conditioning" is only available on a seasonal basis. After May 15. We happened to visit in March. However, the days were 82 and above for the beginning of our trip. The room was extremely hot and stuffy with no way to cool it off. The front desk man told us that it DOES have air conditioning. It's just that it blows hot air before May 15. News flash: That's called a HEATER!! It was not possible to comfortably stay in the room during the day. Rooms were spartan, but ok. The man at the front desk most of the time was extremely unhelpful. He made a sport of giving us wrong or the bare minimum of information whenever we had questions. We were told there were no restaurants in the area. There were 3 within 4 blocks. We were also told there was no store where we could purchase some food. There was a nice market within 3 blocks, a fruit market next to it, and a bakery close by. We asked how to get to the Metro station and were told it was right behind the hotel, but would not specify directions. Unless you were incredibly lucky, you would not find the station without exact directions. It is not "right behind the hotel." I could go on, but it is just more of the same. Very small shower for the type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Barajas”
Reviews.Author: Georgemia
Reviews.Content: High Tech hotel Aeropuerto offers a clean, contemporary property with a convenient shuttle to Barajas, Madrid's airport. It is comfortable and clean. The contemporary design is pleasant, with an emphasis on efficiency. The restaurant was surprisingly good, which is important, because the hotel really isn't close to much. This is a hotel that is good for business travelers and those who need quick access to the airport in the am, and for those customers, it's a good solution. I would not recommend it for visiting Madrid, but it isn't marketed for that.

Reviews.Title: “Tough to find”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaSantaMaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night prior to leaving Spain, since we wanted to be close to the Madrid airport. There was supposed to be a hotel shuttle from the airport when we arrived from Barcelona, but it never showed up. After watching every other hotel shuttle drive by, we took a taxi. The taxi driver had a hard time finding it, even with his GPS he seemed to drive us in circles and then dropped us at the end of a one-way street he couldn't drive down. We took the Metro into Madrid for the day and then had a hard time finding our way back to the hotel in the evening. (Our instructions from the desk clerk TO the Metro consisted of "go right, go right, go right". While that worked on the way there, "go left, go left, go left" in the dark was much more complicated.) The room was just okay, service was just okay. We didn't take the shuttle to the airport for our flight home, since it seemed like all the other guests were taking it as well, and we were in a hurry. (There are 4 Madrid terminals and they're not close to each other.)

Reviews.Title: “adequate for our requirements”
Reviews.Author: Lolabear
Reviews.Content: We returned from a 2 day study visit of Madrid yesterday and chose this hotel because of its proximity to the airport. The hotel itself was fine for our requirements. We went to Madrid with a view to travelling around a lot so didn't spend a great deal of time in the hotel but generally, the rooms were clean and well equipped with everything we needed. Staff were helpful, the hotel seemed quiet (didn't notice any airport noise) and the breakfast was an impressive buffet which more than catered for the differing palettes of a group of 12. The hotel was a 5 min walk from the nearest metro station which will get you into the centre of Madrid in about half an hour - highly recommended because its so cheap. If you were to look hard, the hotel was a little scruffy around the edges and could have done with a lick of paint here or there - but it wasn't bad enough to warrant a complaint. The hotel arranged taxis for our very early start for our return flight as their shuttle service didn't begin until 6am - the taxis arrived on time and cost 20 euros. Incidentally, the hotel's shuttle bus can only carry 8 passengers which the hotel failed to mention when we booked - when we arrived at Madrid airport the remaining 4 members of our party had to pay for a taxi because the shuttle service only calls at the terminal every 40 minutes and the driver wasn't prepared to make the short return trip to pick them up. Generally though, a reasonable hotel for a reasonable cost per night.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good - not that high tech”
Reviews.Author: orangecat1
Reviews.Content: Ok, just stayed here last week. - 20 euro taxi ride from Madrid airport - it's in bad neighborhood -hard for taxi to find -rooms have wood floors - cold and strange -staff are rude (other reviewers said this - i can attest) - i asked for an iron and you'd of though i asked for his first born - their “massage shower” is awkward and annoying to use. - beds are RIDICULOUS hard (see other reviewers comments from same) Look, lots of better places to stay

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: JustBeadIt2
Reviews.Content: Four of us traveling on business booked a night at this hotel through one of the kiosk's at the airport. The woman at the stand said it was the best hotel (4 Star she said) for the money. The hotel looked as though it had never been cleaned. The carpets were filthy, tiles were falling from the bathroom walls and the deadbolt locks on the door did not work for any of the four rooms we booked. I would stay away from this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Ok...for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: granviajerodelmundo
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night before taking an early flight out of Madrid. The hotel looked as though it used to be nice back in the day... but looks as though it has been neglected for a while. Check in was quick. Room was your standard hotel and clean. Only problem was that the dead-bolt lock didn't work and the shower (which looks cool) didn't work either. The location of the hotel is off the beaten path, however there is a Dia supermarket within walking distance, other than that not much else. The free shuttle to the airport left promptly and was not even a five minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Shirleys2b
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a one night stopover in Madrid and was a bit uneasy having read the mixed reviews. The shuttle collected us within ten minutes of calling, which was great. We had booked a family room, which wasn't exactly spacious, but adequate as it was only for one night. The kids had a bunk bed, which was ok for them (aged 16 &13), but for anyone with younger children, beware of the top bunk, there are no protective railings at the sides. We ate in the restaurant,which was fine. The next morning brought mixed blessings - our shuttle didn't turn up when it should have, which meant we ended up calling for a taxi in a panic. This led to us being late checkng in for our flight to Central America........and also a very welcome upgrade to Business plus !!! because all the economy seats were gone, so thank you High Tech Shuttle service for not turning up!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine for Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhyFlyBy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before an early flight out of Madrid. The room was clean and a decent size. The bed was ok. The bathroom was clean and contained a small shower but no tub. The hotel is located very close to the Madrid Airport. I read another traveler’s review saying it was far. That's not true but I have a theory what happened. There are 4 terminals at the airport. The hotel is close to Terminals 1,2, and 3. Terminal 4 is about a 10 minute further away from these terminals. The restaurant is more expensive than what I would expect from an airport hotel. We were hungry but not prepared to pay their prices. Instead we ordered sandwiches from the room service menu at the small bar, which worked out fine. I'm not sure what entitles the hotel to call itself High Tech. They do offer free wireless Internet access but that was the only technology I noticed. The hotel offers a free shuttle bus starting at 6am. Our flight was so early that we needed to take a taxi from the airport at 5am to Terminal 4. This cost 25 euros, which seemed excessive but when you add up the night surcharge and airport surcharge, that's what it cost. The hotel was clean and a reasonable price. If you need an airport hotel in Madrid, this seems like a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: chevychaser
Reviews.Content: After staying in some lovely hotels in Spain which were comparably rated, this hotel was awful. The carpets were filthy, the beds were hard as rocks, the staff only moderately helpful, the restaurant food pedestrian at best, etc. The location although convenient to the airport does not appear to be in a great neighborhood. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: stevphel
Reviews.Content: We managed to miss our connecting flight to Tel Aviv on Saturday and booked this hotel while sitting at a wifi hotspot at the airport with no time to read the reviews. I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. We received an upgraded room with a king bed and computer with hi-speed internet right in the room. A call to reception established the need for a password to access the wifi and everything worked fine. Unlike previous reviews, we did not experienced excessive noise, the hot water was hot, the massage shower worked, the sink worked, the room was clean, and the staff spoke good English. The exercise bike in the room was also a nice adddition. After one night, we asked if we could stay another, our flight back to the US not being until Thursday. The friendly staff gave us the same room, with the same rate until Thursday - could not ask for more. Great job guys. I wish we could say the same about Iberia. PROS Great service and pleasant staff Nice room Internet worked great, WIFI and fixed Lots of great shops and restaurants around the hotel - especially the outside BBQ that opens at night by a private pool complex - just take a walk around and follow your nose. CONS Had to call for shuttle bus to pick us up King bed was VERY firm

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this Dump”
Reviews.Author: Jsfr-7
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in this dump. Booked at the airport at the last moment I wanted a hotel with WiFi access for the night. True, there is Wifi access (after two trips back down to the reception desk to get the login codes). What they don't have is clean rooms, a shuttle bus that works, employees who bother talking to customers (not that they speak ENglish) or Noiseproof walls (I can tell you that my neighbour is Scottish).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for airport access”
Reviews.Author: nancy7484
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel comfortable and the service great. We read the reviews on this website after we booked the hotel and I was a little worried, but I didn't find any of the problems other people complained about. Granted if you want to be in the center of town, this is not a good location. We wanted to be close to the airport, because we were flying out in the morning it was. The shuttle was right there when we wanted to leave in the morning. The food in the restaurant was good and there were other restaurants at the hotel complex right next door. The room was clean and comfortable and the shower worked fine and had hot water. I must admit the shower was a little confusing to operate. I really wonder if the other folks who wrote reports stayed at a different hotel. They could use better signage as you approach the hotel. Our taxi driver located it visually with no problem, but it took us about five circles to figure out what street to turn into to get to the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: Vogel1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night at the end of a one day business trip to Madrid as needed to fly out again early the next morning. Was pleasantly surprised by the room and overall decor of the hotel. All looked very new, modern, and trendy. Room was big with nice wooden floor, big bathroom, nice lighting, free internet access (computer to use provided in the room!). The bathroom was equiped with a nice shower cubicle with normal shower as well as extra body jets and also an option to use the cubicle as a steamroom. Furthermore the room was equiped with an excercise bike, which I thought was a nice extra touch (even though I didn't use it.). Room had double or tripple glazing limiting noise from outside. Staff was smiley and friendly. Only downside was that the walls between rooms seemed thin, so I woke up when my neighbour entered his room in the evening, woke up in the morning, used the bathroom etc. Would probably stay here again if convenient for business, but would not stay at this specific hotel if in Madrid for pleasure due to location. However, I did see this High Tech Hotelles chain has hotels all over Spain (including city based locations) and based on my experience in this hotel I would check out their other hotels if traveling to Spain again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Courtesy Shuttle? It never Showed Up!”
Reviews.Author: mtairy6
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Madrid @ 10:35 PM, and as instructed, contacted this hotel to let them know that I had my luggage and was ready to be picked up. First call placed at 11:15. Airport Hotel desk did not offer to help me at all - in fact, she was on a phone conversation and it was clear that she resented the interruption. Anyway, by 12:15 I had still not been picked up. I called the hotel again, and was told to take a taxi to the hotel and they would pay for it. Unfortunately, I hopped in the cab with a couple who also had reservations at the High Tech....but a different one! Found out that the shuttle service stops at 11:30 for all of the High Tech Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even try it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the airport, but the shuttle is not reliable... if you are planning on using it, reserve and additional hour for the shuttle to pick you up or take you to the airport. We had to wait 45 minutes for the shuttle to pick us at the hotel, and the driver told us the shuttle had no schedule. Rooms are not that bad, but the halls to the rooms are as dirty as they can be. It seems like the carpet has been there for ages without any cleaning. If there is something I can't handle is dirt in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it should be!”
Reviews.Author: carolynjm
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the airport and the free shuttle. Don't count on the shuttle! Once we waited over an hour, again 45 minutes and 1/2 hour the next time. Once we bit the bullet and took a taxi. $10.00. We would have been far better off staying on Gran Via and taking an airport shuttle for $19.00 to and from the airport. We had limited time in Madrid, but spent alot of time waiting for the shuttle to take us to the airport so we could use the Metro. The restaurant was okay, good food, but no variety and menu is the same every day. The room was okay, too, but couldn't control the air conditioning. It would get very cold so we would shut if off and in an hour or so it would be stuffy and warm. We tried to use the pool on Sunday, but it was closed. The staff was not very helpful. I was very disappointed and will not stay there when I am in the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: CalabasasTraveller
Reviews.Content: I was staying here because it´s ´close´to the airport. First you have to call for the shuttle. They said 15-20 minutes. After 25 minutes we called back and they told us half an hour. We´ll you know rather than waiting down by the diesel busses for an hour I´d rather just know it´s going to take an hour. I spoke with the manager who´s a nice guy but basically this is a problem until they get two shuttle busses. Not in the best neighborhood either. -ray

Reviews.Title: “Be careful...it also has some postives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently, my family enjoyed a trip to Spain, this was the only place we had problems...The security is terrible..our bag was stolen directly from the lobby in front of the desk and my family. police are not that responsive nor was the front desk. This is unacceptable, and the hotel did nothing to compensate for thier lack of security. Positives, was the recommendations for dinner and entertainment the choose for us... Both nights were wonderful despite the theft. additionally, The internet system is quite nice as well. The pool...good for some laps.

Reviews.Title: “Staff/Shuttle Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Madrid. My family and I had a bad experience with the desk staff and shuttle. When booking I understood that the shuttle was available from 6AM to Midnight. Our flight was due in at 11:30PM, and unfortunately we were late arriving at 12:10AM. We did't even try to call for the shuttle as I knew it was too late, so tried to take a taxi to the hotel instead. We were refused service by 4 taxi drivers (because it was too close) so I went back into the terminal to call the hotel. They said there was no way the shuttle could pick us up, and recommended that we get the police involved since the taxis were refusing service. It took over 2 hours to contact the correct police (must be municipal police) so by this time it was well past 2AM. I called the hotel asking them to cancel my reservation as it was a huge undertaking to reach them, plus we had to be back in the airport in 4 hours for our flight out the next morning. We would just stay at the airport and try to get at least an hours sleep. The desk staff was very rude, stating that they would charge my credit card (which I had given to reserve the room) regardless because it was our responsibility to reach the hotel. I expressed that I would stop charges on my credit card, and their reply was to "go ahead and try, they would put the charge though somehow." With no means of transportation, there was no way for us to reach this hotel other than taxi or by walking. There were no buses at this late hour. The hotel was not at all helpful in our difficult situation, in fact they were very rude. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone traveling through or connecting through Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the WORST hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from the High Tech Madrid right now -- free internet is about the only thing it has going for it. There is no hot water, only cold and very cold. The service is unhelpful and rather rude - unusual for Spain, since the 10 people we asked for directions in finding this hotel, which was incredibly difficult to find, were very polite. The walls are paper thin, the hotel has no luggage carts and only one baby cot/crib available for all 91 rooms. It is not easily accessible to the center of Madrid and not as conveniently located to airport as they make it seem. Avoid this place.

HotelInfo.Name: High Tech Madrid Aeropuerto Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Galeon 25, 28042 Madrid, Spain
